intro: Apalatoa delagoensis, commonly known as the Delagoense Apalatoa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
